programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A strange woman hires Nick to stop her husband, who she believes is trying to murder her. However, Nick's investigation reveals evidence that leads him to believe she might be more psychotic than paranoid.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick's partner from his DEA days arrives in Key Mariah, with a small time criminal who can help bring down a drug lord who has recently opened his operations in Key Mariah. Complicating matters is Nick's old boss has arrived in Key Mariah & for some reason keeps trying to shut down the investigation.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick reconnects with Maria his old flame from High School. As the two rekindle their relationship it comes out that she is the mistress to a visiting mafia boss. Making matters worse, is the fact mob bosses wife is jealous, and wants her dead!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A local beauty contest turns deadly when the runner up accuses her opponent of cheating to win, and is then the chief suspect in her coach's murder. What seems like an open and shut case slowly becomes more complicated as it seems this case is also tied to a massive jewel theft.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Philippe visits an estuary in North Carolina and catches blue crabs, which have adapted to both saltwater and freshwater. Then Philippe goes to Curacao and takes a submersible 500 feet below the surface to look at sea life. Later, a trip to NASA.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Visit NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and learn how a fleet of satellites is monitoring our planet. Philippe flies in a DC3 aircraft over Arizona as part of NASA's efforts to take soil moisture readings. Also, interviews with numerous Astronauts!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the wild frontier of Alaska. He takes a trip deep into bear country and witnesses a brown bear hunting for salmon. We fly through the Denali National Park and land on a glacier near the tallest mountain in North America.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at ways scientists are measuring the health of our forests. In New England, Philippe visits a white pine forest that is being threatened by invasive plants. At the University of California - Santa Cruz, students use sonic-tomography to look inside trees in order to detect any signs of disease. At the Pine Barrens of New Jersey, we learn about the pitch pine tree.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Terri Gilbert said she didn't know who was coming down the basement steps; she shot and killed him; turned out to be her husband whom she was divorcing; twenty years earlier, she told a similar story, about her first husband.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: Doug Williams grew up without running water in rural Louisiana, played quarterback in an era when few African Americans did, overcoming prejudice and hardship to become a Heisman candidate, a first round draft pick, and ultimately, a Super Bowl MVP.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes led the Kansas City Chiefs to a 38-35 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles with two fourth-quarter touchdown passes and a decisive 26-yard scramble. The Chiefs won their second NFL title in four years and two-time NFL MVP Mahomes earned his second Super Bowl MVP award.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: A tribute to Fritz Pollard, one of pro football's first black players and its first black head coach. Pollard integrated the fledgling NFL a century ago, winning its inaugural title before a wave of segregation cast him aside.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: A pioneering Black quarterback leads Michigan State to new heights and inspires a generation.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The story of one of the greatest players in NFL history and his impact both on and off the field.

programme.title: NFL Media Originals
programme.desc: The film traces the evolution of activism on the part of players of color through generations, shining a light on the realities of being a Black athlete in the NFL then and now.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: A look at the stories, people and places that define the National Football League, including in-depth features that can't be seen anywhere else.

programme.title: Shallow Water
programme.desc: The day after Super Bowl LVIII, the NFL named Queen Tahj Williams as the official designer of Super Bowl LIX's logo.

programme.title: NFL 360
programme.desc: Tyler Lockett returns to his hometown to explore the tragic legacy of the race massacre in the community once known as "Black Wall Street."

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: Doug Williams grew up without running water in rural Louisiana, played quarterback in an era when few African Americans did, overcoming prejudice and hardship to become a Heisman candidate, a first round draft pick, and ultimately, a Super Bowl MVP.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive the Super Bowl XXII matchup between the Denver Broncos and the Washington Redskins. After trailing 10-0 at the end of the first quarter of Super Bowl XXII, the Redskins scored 42 unanswered points, including a record-breaking 35 points in the second quarter, and setting several other Super Bowl records.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The story of one of the greatest players in NFL history and his impact both on and off the field.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: In this edition of NFL Films Presents, learn about the life and times of former Dallas Cowboys linebacker Jeff Rohrer, who became the first NFL player to marry a member of the same sex, when he married his partner in November 2018.

programme.title: The Timeline
programme.desc: Exploring the most memorable cold-weather playoff game in sports history that featured the face-off of two legendary teams: the Dallas Cowboys, led by Tom Landry, and the Green Bay Packers, led by Vince Lombardi.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The legendary coach's rise from his Brooklyn youth to the sidelines of Lambeau Field.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The final years of his life, from his three-peat in Green Bay to his brief tenure as head coach in Washington and his tragic death from cancer.

programme.title: America's Game: The Super Bowl Champions
programme.desc: The 2013 Seattle Seahawks and their run to Super Bowl XLVIII told through the eyes of Russell Wilson, Richard Sherman and Head Coach Pete Carroll. Narrated by Jim Caviezel.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the Seahawks' 31-17 win over the Panthers in the NFC Divisional Round of the NFL Playoffs. Seattle's Legion of Boom smothered Carolina's offense, highlighted by safety Kam Chancellor's team-leading 11 total tackles and 90-yard pick-six.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Super Bowl XIII pegs two budding dynasties against each other, as Roger Staubach and Terry Bradshaw duel; the Pittsburgh Steelers and the Dallas Cowboys each look to become the first franchise to win a third Super Bowl.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Super Bowl XIV pits against each other two of the most dominant defensive fronts, the Pittsburgh Steelers' "Steel Curtain" and the Los Angeles Rams' "Fearsome Foursome" at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: Countdown of the best players to ever wear the gold and red.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The life and career of "Greatest Of All Time" wide receiver, Jerry Rice.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 1981 NFC Championship Game matchup between the Dallas Cowboys and the San Francisco 49ers where San Francisco wide receiver Dwight Clark made a leaping grab in the back of the end zone to complete a 6-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Joe Montana, enabling the 49ers to defeat the Cowboys, 28-27.

programme.title: World Series of Poker

Doyle Brunson, Daniel Negreanu, Phil Ivey, Johnny Chan, Phil Hellmuth, T.J. Cloutier, Annie Duke, Greg Raymer, Howard Lederer, and David "Chip" Reese are set to battle for the $2 million first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: An old man with an Apache bodyguard is wanted for a crime committed long ago.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: Randall is rooked into advancing half the bounty to a man who promises to lead him to Shawnee Bill.

programme.desc: A banker hires Randall to track down the man he believes responsible for his son's death and a bank robbery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Randall must transport a killer to Tucson, but exchanges him for the nun kidnapped by the killer's gang.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: Mitch finds himself falling for an Italian actress who is being stalked by ruthless robbers.

programme.desc: Mitch is paralyzed when he saves three teenagers. Can the team rally to repair his shattered life?

programme.desc: Mitch's ex-wife flies in for a weekend visit and informs Mitch she is taking Hobie to Ohio.

programme.desc: A prison break gone awry finds Mitch held hostage and forced to perform surgery.

programme.desc: Mitch removes a bullet from an escaped convict, only to realize that he plans on killing him.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.desc: Ten celebrities from the world of sport and television take on one of the most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Amityville: A New Generation
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Sorority House Massacre
programme.desc: A college student and her sorority sisters are stalked by an escaped psychopathic killer who shares a strange bond of telepathy with her.

programme.title: Nightbreed
programme.desc: Aaron Boone (Craig Sheffer) is haunted by terrifying nightmares of a city of monsters. He goes to see a psychiatrist, Dr. Decker (David Cronenberg), for help. But what Boone doesn't know is that Decker is really a serial killer. Decker frames Boone to take the fall for his murders, and Boone is killed by the police. But Boone is brought back to life by the monsters of his dreams, the Nightbreed, who in turn join Boone in his quest to stop Decker from killing again.

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: Will accepts an invitation to a dinner party hosted by his ex-wife and her new husband and begins to suspect an ambush when the affair goes awry.

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Eden Lake
programme.desc: A British couple takes a trip to a private and isolated lake quarry for a vacation, only to be targeted by a lurking mob of psychotic teenagers.

programme.title: Better Watch Out
programme.desc: In this holiday horror farce, a babysitter must hold the fort and protect a 12-year-old boy during an increasingly bizarre home invasion.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: On a desolate stretch of mountain road, a friendly truck driver who enjoys slaughtering hitchhikers meets a charming hitchhiker who prefers to butcher anyone who gives him a ride.

programme.title: Masters of Horror
programme.desc: A shy entomologist's drab life is changed by the simultaneous arrival of a large, mysterious bug and a torrid affair with a sexy young woman (erotic scream queen Misty Mundae).

programme.title: Amityville: The Evil Escapes
programme.desc: The demonic forces that haunted the infamous Long Island house escape through a mystical lamp to California, where evil manipulates a little girl.

programme.title: Body Bags
programme.desc: Three different horror stories bring a serial killer, a botched hair transplant, and a baseball player to a deranged coroner's morgue.

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plants out some tender plants, takes cuttings from herbs and sows carrots. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein goes back to the basics of propagating your own plants when she shows how to take cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Monty at Longmeadow for an indulgent, horticultural romp through the `Gardeners' World' archives and a joyous riot of colour as we celebrate some of our most beloved summer flowers. From Delphiniums to Clematis, Irises and Dahlias expert growers share their passion along with hints and tips. Carol Klein visits a garden in Worcestershire where she discovers picture perfect peonies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to pot tomatoes on to the next stage of their growth. Adam Frost has ideas of transforming a part of his garden into a seating area using a few logs and plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds a variety of herbs that thrive in shade to the herb garden and adds summer annuals to the cottage garden. Nick Bailey has taken a rare opportunity to design his town garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out tender vegetables for late summer harvests and gives tips on plants that thrive on a minimum of water when he plants up a pot of succulent plants. Frances Tophill demonstrates an unusual method of reducing weeds in her allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Kierti Vaidya's alpaca farm in Warwickshire that has run into difficulties.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits Nick and Talitha, who hope to make a new life for themselves from two acres of land.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty visits city girl Jen and her country cousin Bek who have started a flower farm in Kent.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on growing tomatoes and has ideas of how to fill gaps in the garden once the flowers of spring are past their best. The team meet an extraordinary gardener from Swansea, whose upper limb difference has not deterred her.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Looking back to those 'days of old', Bob Ross paints a delightful little fishing village with luscious leafy trees in an oval.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Winter scenes don't have to be cold! With a touch of the sun's warmth, Bob Ross turns the chill of winter into a golden day.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Grandest of mountains overlooking an incredibly breathtaking waterfall … a Bob Ross painting you must see to believe!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Lovely soft colors flow from the magnificent brushes of Bob Ross in this lovely warm winter painting … don't miss seeing this pretty scene unfold.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Pick up your brushes and paint along with Bob Ross - he creates a beautiful, rocky stream gently rippling through the forest mist in an oval.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a spectacular mountain scene in a faux matte; a real masterpiece cleverly framed in an intriguing new idea!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Under the most glorious of skies, enjoy the rhythmic flow of deep sea waters crashing and splashing upon the surrounding rocks and cliffs - Bob Ross style!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A fantastic Bob Ross seascape today - enjoy the golden, pink and mauve tones in the sky and crashing waves.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Find yourself in a gorgeous late-afternoon mountain masterpiece by Bob Ross -- breathtaking purples skies, defined evergreens and smooth lake.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of Team Winchester shooters Zach Kienbaum and Desirae Edmunds is told. Zach and Desi discuss how they got started in the shooting sports and how important coaching has become to both of them. They also talk shooting tips. Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Hunter Bach takes Blair to the northern part of the Indian River to catch redfish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team highlighted deck repair and antique motor restoration, including storage solutions and structural enhancements.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; cruising the almighty Seine River through France, from Paris up to the battlefields of WWI. Enjoying the food and wine of the area, while learning about the history and experiencing the culture of this glorious region.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode, we catch up with and old friend of ours, Carl Parks. Carl's son CJ was killed in a tragic accident 6 years ago and we're gonna spend a day of fishing and reflection and celebration of CJ's life; We spent time with Carl years ago not long after the accident and filmed and episode called "The Wake" and now want to catch up again to showcase Carl's faith and strength that's helped him with his journey in life after losing his son.

programme.title: the_direction
programme.desc: This week Mark is joined by a couple of proud Veterans and father/son duo, James and Jeff Hall. James Hall served in the Navy back before Mark was even born. His son Jeff used the GI bill to pursue his education and training for his machining career that he still enjoys today. Jeff has also gone on to foster and even adopt children during his life. What a special day listening to the stories of both of these men and it's easy to notice the pride and character of both men and the love they have for family and country. Special thanks to West Boggs Park for supporting this program each year.

programme.title: The Greatest

programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: Little Nikita
programme.desc: Roy Parmenter (Sidney Poitier) is an FBI agent with a long-standing vendetta against a Russian spy named Scuba (Richard Lynch). Now, Scuba is blackmailing the Soviet government by tracking down and assassinating their sleeper agents in the United States. Parmenter discovers that high-school student Jeff Grant (River Phoenix) is the son of two such agents (Caroline Kava, Richard Jenkins), which is a total shock to Jeff. Parmenter must try to track Scuba while also protecting the Grants.

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: The sci-fi splatter hit about a military crew of men and women forced into an intergalactic war against a relentless and violent alien species.

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: New father and husband Zorro wears his mask for justice when greedy land barons plot to keep California from becoming the 31st state in the U.S.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: The Marine 6: Close Quarters
programme.desc: Jake Carter and another former Marine, Luke Trapper, join forces to rescue a kidnapped girl from a gang of international criminals.

programme.title: The People Across the Lake
programme.desc: What starts off as an idyllic new life in a picture-perfect cottage for a couple fed up with the city ends up as murder and mystery in a quaint town.

programme.title: Justice for Natalee Holloway
programme.desc: Four years after the disappearance of her teenage daughter, a mother teams with the FBI to investigate another crime committed by the prime suspect.

programme.title: Florence Nightingale
programme.desc: Set in early 1840s Britain, this biopic details the life of Florence Nightingale, who is considered to be the pioneer of modern nursing.

programme.title: Masterminds
programme.desc: A tech geek expelled from school for pulling pranks on staff becomes the one person with enough savvy to rescue students from a gang of kidnappers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Gloria
programme.desc: Released from prison, Gloria finds herself the reluctant guardian of a young boy who has become the target of a ruthless multinational conglomerate.

programme.title: Striking Distance
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and Sarah Jessica Parker star in this crime thriller about a demoted homicide cop who works with his partner to find his father’s killer.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Man
programme.desc: Clumsy sanitation worker Red Jones (Red Skelton) is fired from his street-cleaning job shortly after his girlfriend, Ann Elliot (Janet Blair), refuses his marriage proposal until he betters himself. While training to become a door-to-door salesman, he accidentally stumbles into a murder investigation when the corrupt sanitation commissioner (Nicholas Joy) who had fired him is killed. When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: J.W. Coop
programme.desc: After spending a decade behind bars for writing bad checks and punching a cop, former rodeo star J.W. Coop (Cliff Robertson) re-enters a world drastically different from how he left it; the only constant seems to be his mother (Geraldine Page). Gradually coming to terms with societal changes and cultural norms, Coop is determined to climb back to the top spot on the rodeo circuit. Along the way, he hooks up with Bean (Cristina Ferrare), a liberated woman who helps him catch up to modern life.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Texas
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers Dan (William Holden) and Tod (Glenn Ford) look to Texas for opportunities when the war ends. Upon witnessing a stagecoach robbery, the close friends ambush the outlaws and confiscate the stolen funds. Tod wishes to return the money, but Dan wants to keep it. After a sheriff gives chase, each man runs off on his own. They are reunited after some time, but with Tod now an honest ranch hand and Dan an outlaw cattle rustler, the two do not know if their friendship can survive.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: Legend of the Golden Gun
programme.desc: After his family is killed, a quiet, young farmer turns into a deadly gunfighter, dedicating his life to the pursuit of evildoers.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: For the Love of Lily
programme.desc: A career-minded city girl must build a garden with a plant-loving country boy to appease her boss.

programme.title: Baby Boot Camp
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Julia is down on her luck trying to make her baby boot camp a thriving business. To make ends meet she becomes a part-time nanny for a widower father--although she knows nothing about taking care of children.

programme.title: Write Place, Write Time
programme.desc: A woman attempts to give her dreams of being a writer one last go by anonymously providing content to her mother's declining publishing company.

programme.title: You, Me, and that Mountain Retreat
programme.desc: Partnered with nature-hating Nathan, Rebecca is put to the test during a work mountain retreat.

programme.title: Beyond the Night
programme.desc: When a soldier's son reveals damning info about a local gangster's missing daughter, a war of attrition ensues.

programme.title: Anatomy Of Deception
programme.desc: A district attorney tapped to replace the outgoing mayor, is stalked by a man who engineers her fall.

programme.title: Ties that Bind
programme.desc: Detective takes in her jailed brothers unruley teenagers whilst looking after her own and solving crime.

programme.title: Wild Faith
programme.desc: A Civil War vet makes peace with his losses and starts a new life with the world resisting change around him.

programme.title: Candid About Love

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fiancé Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a "color run" to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: FourWheeler

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian and his friends visit off-road parks and enjoy some Tennessee whiskey.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings back the Suzuki Samurai for an old-fashioned engine swap.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian rebuilds the dash on the LJ Buggy and adds some off-road lights.

programme.title: FourWheeler

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The JK stretch project is ready for an all-new suspension and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian outfits his Nissan Titan to tow his new Tracker side by side.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The RamCharger needs to be outfitted for overlanding.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian tears down a Dodge Dakota and turns it into a tools-carrying monster.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian works on the Shop Truck Dakota's transmission and axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian finds the perfect service bed and finishes up with a custom paint job.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets invited to ride in the 2020 Ultimate Adventure.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian starts work on an all-aluminum Defender that has a Jeep JK chassis.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian installs more of the Defender's drivetrain, plus wheels and tires.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian creates his own short bed Jeep Gladiator by transforming a Jeep JK.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian modifies a 1998 Chevy T6500 for towing, overlanding and motorhoming.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian makes tons of custom parts to finish the All-Aluminum Defender project.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets a cheap Mercedes 300D ready for a local Gambler 500 rally.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian continues the Tacoma project, but this time he completely reshapes the truck with a fiberglass body kit and truck cap, then cuts out the rear window to give it a vintage 4Runner look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes the All-Aluminum Defender on the Kentucky Adventure Trail.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns a stack of tubes into a shorter trail chassis and adds new axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The mock-up on the trail chassis continues as Ian adds a motor and transmission to the build; it's time to get axles underneath with a new third member so he can go four-wheel drive all the time.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin is excited to see a straight '63 Impala with a four speed and legendary 409 engine under the hood; the owner wants to keep it original with the main mods under the body, new frame, suspension and big wheels.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A new customer, comes into the shop with an exceptional 1963 Cadillac; this car screams luxury but needs an upgrade; with Shane giving the MBC team creative freedom on the build, Joe gets to work on a plan; new engine, new wheels and a new interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Return customer Lee Farris comes to Martin Bros with a 1956 Chevy Bel Air, his first car that he wants to bring back to life; the first thing Joe notices is the outdated flame paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe makes a high-risk move and chops the top off of a 1950 Mercury coupe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With the 1950 Mercury successfully chopped, the rest of the work can begin; the MBC team now has to marry the old roof with the new geometry of the newly chopped body; there are angles everywhere and they are all out of whack.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers have hauled more than 100,000 tons of supplies in temperatures of forty degrees below zero, but accidents and strict safety regulations have sent many drivers packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's just over a month into the new ice road season and more than 800 truckers are on the ice, working around the clock.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 37 of the ice road season and there almost 3,000 more loads to go. Drivers are washing out and the road is beaten up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Just five days into the Arctic adventure, Mother Nature is about to strike and wreak havoc on the ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The truckers have delivered the fragile 135-foot derrick to the new MGM exploration site.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Bear and Eric must haul a boiler and a flare stack--two critical pieces of equipment.

programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive he always promises them that it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Darkness has fallen, but with the trail hot and the stakes high Dog and posse refuse to let up. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's relentless ruthlessness is being put to the test on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog is tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale. But this only masks deeper problems with the couple.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district--moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rebecca Schaeffer was talented, pretty, and had her whole life ahead of her when she unknowingly opened the door of her Hollywood apartment to her killer Robert Bardo. Bardo's lawyers say his mental illness caused him to snap.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rabbi Fred Neulander was a pillar of his Cherry Hill, New Jersey community - the founder of a synagogue, a father and a husband. Little did anyone know, he was also an adulterer, one capable of hiring a hitman to murder his own wife.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Melanie McGuire made a living bringing life into the world as a fertility clinic nurse; the police accused her of shooting her husband, dismembering his body and disposing of it in suitcases dumped into the Chesapeake Bay.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: A Top End trawler demolition bites back for Team Salvage as a five-meter croc patrols the area on a free-for-all mechanical nightmare; Shaun and Sarah dig deep as a wreck on the beach pushes them to breaking point.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: On the tropical frontier of the Northern Territory, Team Salvage take on a time-critical mission to re-float and recover a derelict 20-ton yacht that's been blown ashore.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: At a marine sanctuary in the far Northern Territory, Team Salvage must overcome a mechanical catastrophe to recover a beached 7-ton Catamaran.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Murphy’s Historic Hotel near Sacramento in northern California, where party-boy owners Brian, Kevin and Joel are too busy drinking, partying and lap-dancing in the rowdy bar, to look after their historic hotel.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to Connecticut’s oldest inn, the Curtis House. This historic inn has been run by the Hardisty family for generations, but the business has started to fall apart and the family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call “daddy”), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team take the risk of packing up shop and moving to Gove in the Northern Territory, where they have been hired by the local council to retrieve an infamous landmark.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Team Salvage is on a back-to-back muddy monster machine in the Northern Territory.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: An environmental clean-up mission to remove a toxic rotting vessel that's trapped on a beach in the Northern Territory.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke Purdy, Jacinta Burns and underground explosive expert and miner Vince venture further off the grid to the Northern Territory.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: The team battles to rescue a 130-ton Road Train from a flooded river crossing; Shaun and Sarah dig deep to uncover a bounty of buried salvage.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Removing a 50-ton trawler from a historic beach; Shaun and Sarah tear through their profits to recover a wreck.

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: A Top End trawler demolition bites back for Team Salvage as a five-meter croc patrols the area on a free-for-all mechanical nightmare; Shaun and Sarah dig deep as a wreck on the beach pushes them to breaking point.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The Dovecote is a bistro in the heart of rural Devon run by a family at breaking point. The restaurant is on its last legs - they've run out of customers, money and hope. Enter Gordon, who on his first visit to the bistro is confronted with hideous wallpaper, vacuum packed lamb and a pig-headed head chef and owner who can't face up to his mistakes. Gordon has a torrid time putting them on the road to recovery, but come the autumn, they are sticking to his rules and business is looking brighter.
With the advent of the credit crunch, soaring food prices, thrifty clientele and unrelenting competition from the high street chains, Gordon is determined to galvanise the owners, the staff and the local community to ensure their survival and keep customers coming back for more.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~£1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The White House has consistently denied having any knowledge of alien craft visiting Earth, but presidential encounters with UFOs and other strange phenomena can be found going all the way back to George Washington.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: "Ancient Aliens" has examined the oldest and most mysterious rock art on Earth up close, and Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the incredible hieroglyphs, petroglyphs, and geoglyphs that he believes tell a worldwide story of alien visitation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Following investigators across the globe as they go to the sites where signs of alien life have been found; Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at incredible evidence that could offer definitive proof that humans are not alone in the universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look back at some extraordinary encounters that may provide evidence of an extraterrestrial presence on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The team investigates the world's oldest and most incredible relics up close; Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most mysterious artifacts from all over the globe, those he believes provide undeniable proof of extraterrestrial contact.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most compelling investigations of all, and events that he believes represent real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Extraterrestrials could be altering human DNA and repopulating the Earth with alien-human hybrids; following the trail of evidence from ancient cultures to modern-day animal mutilations and alien abductions.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A perfectly masterminded plot leads to one of the most brazen prison breaks in American history; with only a handful of clues left behind, the search for the infamous Alcatraz escapees continues to this day.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On February 24, 1942, less than three months after the Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor, military radar picks up what appears to be enemy aircraft over Los Angeles.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: For decades experts believe they know what caused the Hindenburg disaster: that leaking hydrogen--causing the airship to burst into flames; but there may be more to this story.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The story of the most celebrated warrior king in history still stirs fascination more than 2,000 years after his death. But the location of his body is the subject of much debate. When his remains suddenly disappear without a trace, a search across the ancient world ensues. What happened to the mummy of Alexander the Great?

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The haunting image of the Shroud of Turin has captivated millions around the world; scientists and theologians are trying to figure out if the Shroud of Turin truly is an image of Jesus or something very different.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The Titanic's tragic story captures the imagination of the public and experts of all kinds, who, decades after the ship's demise, still seek answers; a look into new evidence that might reveal more about how and why the Titanic sank.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The death of one of history's most enigmatic rulers, Egypt's King Tutankhamun remains shrouded in mystery 3300 years later. Scientific advancements may be getting us closer to the identity of King Tut's killer.
